text: this is called been after my producer
this is called Jeremy after my editor
then meet Jeremy naming coke cans is
what a coca-cola marketing campaign was
all about but what if I renamed one of
these cans gay
we tried typing gay onto a coke can
using the share a coke marketing website
oops
it said let's pretend he didn't just
type that this is a South African
coca-cola site but the storm of online
anger it provoked is about Russia and it
started in the USA my blog post about
the share a coke site was really
incredibly popular I was surprised at
how viral really this was about an
anti-gay law that was passed in Russia
last summer last year Russia banned
propaganda to under-18 about what
legislators called non-traditional
sexual relations now any multinational
firm that sponsors the upcoming Winter
Olympics in Russia is being targeted by
gay rights activists online like Coke
but also McDonald's whose cheers to
Sochi hashtag was hijacked only being
unfair to these companies I mean this is
marketing it's not political you know I
think the problem is this isn't just
about ranting in marketing it's about
money both companies told us they
support gay rights coca-cola changed
their website after we contacted them
now it just lists names you can put on
your coke can and they say they
apologise for any offence caused
